step1.sentence: She finally broke through the language barrier after six months of daily practice.

step2.story: The protesters pushed forward and broke through the barrier that had been set up at the entrance of the square. Officers quickly moved in to restore order.

step3.story: For three years, the young scientist had been working on a protein folding problem that had stumped researchers for decades. She tried dozens of approaches without success. Then one Tuesday afternoon, she adjusted one variable on a hunch and ran the simulation again. The result broke through the wall she had been facing. She sat very still for a moment, then called her supervisor.

meaning.literalMeaningKo: 장벽이나 방해물을 뚫고 나아가다; 중요한 장애물을 극복하다.
meaning.realUsageKo: 물리적 장벽이나 오랫동안 막혀있던 문제를 마침내 돌파할 때 씁니다.
meaning.etymologyKo: break(깨다, 뚫다)와 through(통과하여)가 결합하여 막고 있는 것을 뚫고 지나간다는 의미가 되었습니다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 물리적 돌파와 비유적 돌파(연구, 기술 등의 전환점) 모두에 씁니다. breakthrough라는 명사형도 자주 씁니다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: The team finally broke through and found a solution after weeks of effort.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 팀은 수 주간의 노력 끝에 마침내 해결책을 찾아냈어요.
